Package org.gearman

The java-gearman-service is an implementation of the Gearman framework, used to farm out work to other machines or processes that are better suited to do the work.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    GearmanClient
    The gearman client is used to submit jobs to the job server.
    GearmanFunction
    A GearmanFunction provides the interface to create functions that can be executed by the GearmanWorker.
    GearmanFunctionCallback
    The interface used by the GearmanFunction to send data back to the client mid-process.
    GearmanJobEvent
    An object representing job update
    GearmanJobEventCallback<A>
    The GearmanJobEventCallback class is used to handle job result events ( GearmanJobEvent) asynchronously.
    GearmanJobReturn
    The gearman job return is used to receive incoming job data from the job server.
    GearmanJobStatus
    An immutable object specifying a job's status
    GearmanJoin<A>
    The GearmanJoin class is used to block the current thread until a job has completed and been completly proccessed.
    GearmanLostConnectionPolicy
    Specifies what to do when a job server unexpectedly disconnects or a service cannot connect to a job server.
    GearmanPersistable
    An object representing a persistable background job.
    GearmanPersistence
    An application hook telling the framework how jobs will persist.
    GearmanServer
    The gearman job server receives jobs from the client and distributes them to available workers
    GearmanService
    All Gearman services implements the GearmanService interface
    GearmanWorker
    A Gearman Worker is responsible for executing the jobs it receives from the job server.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Gearman
    A Gearman object defines a gearman systems and creates gearman services.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    GearmanJobEventType
    An enumerator defining the job event type
    GearmanJobPriority
    Used to define the job priority at the time of submission
    GearmanLostConnectionAction
    An enumerator used to tell the framework what action to take when a remote server unexpectedly disconnects.
    GearmanLostConnectionGrounds
    Specifies why a connection was lost

Package org.gearman Description

The java-gearman-service is an implementation of the Gearman framework, used to farm out work to other machines or processes that are better suited to do the work. It allows you to do work in parallel, to load balance processing, and to call functions between languages. It can be used in a variety of applications, from high-availability web sites to the transport of database replication events. In other words, it is the nervous system for how distributed processing communicates.
